runs.comm: spinner to start, clipped gently to midwicket
almost success first up here, Gayle leaning on one and getting a leading edge looping towards cover
oops, this time it's fired down the leg side
good ball here, on a length and line and zipping past the outside edge
that's what every West Indian wants to see, Gayle strides forward, swings his enormous arms through the ball and send it flying down the ground for four
and again! Top shot, looks so effortless, just a half-stride forward and bunts it down past mid on for a boundary
full toss served up, but the mid on has gone back so Gayle punches it down the ground for a single
gentle start given that build up, outside off, good length and left alone
this won't please Gayle, pitches again on a decent enough length but borrows through to the keeper
Steyn is lucky to get away with this, skidded full and into Gayle's hitting arc, as it was it was drilled to cover
this time Gayle picks the gap, opening the face and leaning this between point and cover for a couple
after that one a couple of balls ago kept low, this really climbed, pitching short and zipping past Gayle's head
oh dear, poor umpiring here, and not for the first time this game, a clear wide arrowed down the leg side, but the umpire Clive Duncan gives no wide. Gayle asks why and gets no answer.
the spin experiment is over, and McLaren comes into the attack, Fletcher, who needs some runs, defends a full ball carefully
action replay, full, on off stump, Fletcher pushes to cover

Fletcher gone now, that is sad to see. He kept very well but his batting is looking very suspect at this level. Decent ball outside off, flat-footed fence from Fletcher, edged it through to the new keeper, who took a smart catch going quickly to his right
Bravo keeps his first ball out easily enough, jabbing a bat down on a fullish delivery
a touch airy this shot, Bravo driving a bit too early on the shot towards cover, the calling isn't great but they eventually collect a single
oh no, another poor umpiring call, this landed miles wide of Gayle's off stump, but the umpire decides it's fine. Good day to be a bowler
this is a more solid shot, Bravo getting forward confidently and offering the fullest of faces to a pitched-up delivery
Langeveldt has settled into a good line straight away, and it's defended into the off side
well, because this came off it's a good shot, pulled off the front foot, high in the air and wide of square leg for four
this is very good, no doubt, fullish and straying on to leg, clipped through mid on for another boundary
Bravo looking decent now, slipping this leg side ball into the midwicket region for a single
Gayle defends this with a Boycott-like straight bat, this man knows nothing if not how to defend

Steyn and Bravo are two of the most attacking cricketers around, and this ball shows it, pitched well up, looking for the wicket, Bravo launches an expansive drive, skews off the edge past point for a couple
touch more circumspect this time, good line and length and defended with utmost caution
eep, that's not what a batsman wants to see, this slower cutter pitched and kept well low, Bravo dabbed a bat and collected one to midwicket
Gayle looking in responsible mood, which is a strange set of words, this is carefully worked into the leg side
good bouncer this, bang on a line and searching for the throat, Bravo hopped and ducked at the same time, and got under it smartly
lovely ball this, following up the bouncer with a full ball attacking the stumps, Bravo defends in a hurry

big wicket! Gayle has gone! Slower ball from McLaren, back of a good length, Gayle went for an expansive pull shot, looking to clear long on with the breeze, didn't get much of it in the end, only succeeded in spooning it to Smith two-thirds of the way back to the boundary
good ball first up, fullish on off stump, defended confidently into the covers
angled down the leg side this time, clips Sarwan's thigh on the way through to the keeper skipping down the leg side
this time it has slipped too far down leg, and now it is given a wide
angling in at the stumps from a fullish length, dug out to mid on
good full length once more, edged to point for a single
there is a magnetic flourish to everything Bravo does, even working this ball routinely to leg, he manages to get on one leg and flick his wrists, unbounded enthusiasm
well, I can't actually describe that delivery because the coverage preferred to show some dancing women, I think it went to point
this certainly did go to point, the TV coverage kind enough to show Sarwan cutting a shortish ball firmly
nicely played this time, waiting on it and dabbing it late towards third man for a single
Kallis is offering enough width to keep point very busy, once again this is forced away into that area firmly
much fuller and and straighter, Sarwan works it back to the bowler
nicely played once more, pushed into space for a single
given some air from Botha, which is rare, and clipped down the ground for a single
touch flatter this time, but very straight and Bravo can't get it away
well bowled again, bang on a length and line and Bravo pushes to cover
this time the line is right but the length is wrong - a full toss in fact - and clipped to midwicket fora single
another gentle nurdle away for one into the midwicket region
overs slipping by, West Indies need to work the ball around a touch better if they are to have a chance, this is tapped into the off side
given that nobody has timed the ball well all day, this is a decent shot, back of a length and pulled between long on and midwicket for a much-needed boundary
back to the dots here though as this slower ball passes, eventually, the outside edge
fuller from Kallis, and Sarwan drives to mid on well enough for one
Bravo bustles another single, working a fullish ball to mid on and setting off for an eager run
this is a nice shot for one, too nice for one really, opening the face, waiting and back-cutting to third man
fuller and slower from Kallis, well outside off stump, but a flick of the wrists sends it to midwicket for a couple, good over for West Indies that
Botha continues to choke, Botha-constrictor, guffaw. Darted in at off stump, cut without timing to short third man
touch more airy this time, allows Sarwan to work it down to Amla at long on
oh dear, that is the end for Bravo, skipped down the wicket and chipped down the throat of long on, never looked like clearing the fielder. Big wicket and South Africa will feel comfortable
the batsmen crossed, which gives Sarwan the chance to drive very tidily to cover
this is comfortably worked away off the front foot to mid on for a single

oh great stuff from De Villiers. Leg-side stumpings always give me a giddy thrill. Fired down the leg side by Botha, a wide in fact, but Deonarine overbalanced as he missed his leg-side flick and De Villiers had the bails off in a flash, very smart work indeed.
Pollard faces his first ball and rather than try and heave it out the ground he sensibly pushes it into the leg side for a single
Pollard is all grace and delicacy here, tapping a leg side ball gently to short fine leg
this time he feathers it to midwicket, soft enough to collect one
Sarwan can't match Pollard's soft hands, turning this firmly to short midwicket
it's all unravelling now. Sarwan falls! Playing a fraction too early to one held back in the air, smart bowling, gets a leading edge which loops to cover, who dives forward to gobble up the chance
Sammy. who is always a picture of diligence, calmly works this full ball around the corner for one
on the flat tracks of the IPL, Pollard made mince-meat of some of the third-rate back-up bowlers, here he has to carefully push this away for a couple behind square on the leg side
Botha is arrow straight, darting them in, defended carefully back to the bowler
nicely worked down the ground here, gentle single, calm before the storm perhaps
they are interviewing some kids on TV, which is rather lovely, they all love Chris Gayle,
carefully defended back to the bowler
once again it's defended, not much Sammy can do with Botha's darts
and again, this is Test match cricket at it's best, prodded back to the bowler
slightly angled down the leg side, thuds off the pads for a sedate single
nothing on offer here, just tight wicket-to-wicket bowling and pushed back to the bowler
Sammy needs to find some angles to rotate the strike, full-facing it back to the bowler will take them nowhere
filthy ball, short but zipping through quicker, Sammy mows a pull to short fine leg
touch of extra bounce here, Sammy is shocked and stands up, edging it tamely into the third man region
well, Sammy keeps the strike, he is defending very well to be fair, pushing this with complete conviction into the off side for one
ideal for West Indies, Sammy finds the gap at mid on and picks up one
Pollard is shimming and ducking and moving while Botha runs up, it makes very little difference to the bowler who arrows it in on a good line, deflected away into the leg side for one
dabbed gloriously for a single, Sammy finding his range here, just two of those a ball and they'll have a chance
nicely played by Pollard here, worked away into the leg side for a couple
this time it's pushed down the ground for another muscular single
huzzah! some intent from Sammy and it's just about worked. Skipping down the track and lifting it, a touch speculatively, between mid on and midwicket for four
you sensed all Pollard was waiting for was some pace on the ball, and here it is, pitched up and Pollard swished mightily at fresh air and the ball whistled past the edge
another swing and another miss, when he connects it will either be out or six
or four, as the case may be, full toss and this time it was swatted off almost the middle of the bat, wide of long on for four
another full toss, the sort of low-full toss that used to pass as yorkers in the old days, comes off the bottom edge of the the leg-side mow and trickles away for a couple down to long on
eep, not a great ball that from Langeveldt, high full toss angling down leg, Pollard helps it on its way round the corner for four more!
better ball here from Langeveldt, full and wide, Pollard jabs it wide of short third man for a couple more, good stuff from him
Sammy needs to give Pollard the strike, that's all he's needed to do all innings really, instead he stands perfectly still and swiped at nothing in particular
much shorter, gets some good bounce, and swung away off the back foot down to fine leg for a single
Pollard! This is what he's there for, smashing mediocre bowling, full and into his hitting range and smashed down the ground for six
McLaren strikes back straight away! Top stuff, yorker length, and squeezes between a swirling bat and a rooted pad and canons into leg stump, that's the game up you feel
Miller plays his first ball towards point and there is no run
fuller ball this time, driven down the ground, for a lung-busting couple
full from Steyn, outside off, Sammy plays it well, driving square to deep point for a couple
slower cutter from Steyn here, well wide of off stump, and the umpire decides it's too far
and again, too wide of off, a swing, a miss, and a wide
Sammy looking for a big smash over long on, as it he can't quite connect
and again! Backing away looking for the inside-out smash, but failing to connect
hmm, too wide of off again, Sammy repeats the shot, repeats the miss but is rewarded this time with a wide
finally Steyn gets close enough for Sammy to connect, doesn't quite manage to time it but collects a single to cover
mistimed to cover again, very quick, suicidal single attempted, if the throw had had he would have gone
touch fuller this time, Sammy tries to swing it through cover again, but it zips past the edge
good ball from Langeveldt, climbing from back of a length, flat-footed swipe attempted, which is all you can do at this stage, but it goes past the edge
Miller connects this time, swiping the ball down to long on for a couple
gone this time, really massive heave across the line from Miller, but he only manages a top edge and it passes through to De Villiers
good ball from Langeveldt, right up in the blockhole, Taylor digs it out and collects a single
dropped, McLaren puts down a regulation chance at long off, full toss thwacked down the ground, McLaren got around smartly and spilled the chance
"home-run!" declares Tony Cozier, full toss, swiped handsomely over long on into the stands
fullish ball outside off, big shot attempted, sadly it's missed
repeat of Steyn's last over here, too wide outside off, and a bonus run
Sammy has laid his cards clearly on the table, he is aiming over cover, swinging hard at this but missing once more
Steyn is a touch annoyed with himself, and why not, this is again shoved well outside off
after a quick chat with his captain it looked as though Steyn would attack the stumps, but it  was still wide of off
bowled him! Off a no ball. Steyn adjust his line, spears in a leg stump yorker, hits the stumps, but he overstepped free hit time
oh dear, this is a touch farcical. Another wide miles outside off stump, another play and miss off, but a bye attempted, Sammy stands perfectly still, Taylor ears up the crease and ends up run out
would you believe it? I guess so, well wide of off, and we still have a free hit
yorker on the stumps, actually straight, it passes though to the keeper, they think about a bye, the throw comes in from behind the stumps, nobody fields it, so the end up getting a single
shot! Benn swings it mightily down the ground, timing it perfectly and it flies down to the mid on boundary

oh no, the umpiring has got worse, the match even more bizzare, Benn gets a thick edge to a length ball he tried to swing over midwicket, regulation catch to the keeper, given not out, everyone is confused and the over, finally, ends
nicely bunted down the ground from a fullish length, a slight fumble at long off means allows a second
another wide, outside off, Sammy had wandered down the wicket, De Villiers under-arms the throw back in a flash and the Sammy is run out
good ball from McLaren, right up into the yorker length, dug out to mid on for a well-run couple
Roach getting his eye in I guess, working this, quite stylishly into the square leg region for  a single
Benn runs leg side of the ball, aiming to slam it over cover, but it's full and outside off and he misses

and that is that. Benn connects with a big shot down the ground, can't quite time it well enough, Amla takes an easy chance to finish the game. McLaren has five wickets, which is a rare feat in this format
